visual_elements.description: Figure 25: Front elevation showing an accessory structure (garage-like building) with a sloped 'daylight plane' originating from the side lot line. Dimensions indicate a maximum height of 12' for the building and an 8' height from average grade where the daylight plane begins its slope. The daylight plane slopes inward from a point 1' horizontally from the side lot line and 3' vertically from the top of the building's wall.

Figure 26: Side elevation showing an accessory structure (garage-like building) with a sloped 'daylight plane' originating from the rear lot line. Dimensions indicate a maximum height of 12' for the building and an 8' height from average grade where the daylight plane begins its slope. The daylight plane slopes inward from a point 1' horizontally from the rear lot line and 3' vertically from the top of the building's wall.

A square diagram labeled 'Side', 'Front', and 'Rear' with arrows indicating directions. An upward arrow points towards 'Side' from the center, a downward arrow points away from 'Side' from the center, and a rightward arrow points towards 'Rear' from the center. This likely illustrates the orientation of the lot and the directions of the daylight planes.
